title: all taylor swift songs
text:
This data set comes from the taylor R package, which compiles a curated collection of Taylor Swift songs including lyrics and audio characteristics. The data originates from Genius and the Spotify API. The visualization displays the trend in average song duration over time, showing the average length of songs each year from before 1960 up through 2020.

library(readr) 
taylor_all_songs <- read_csv("taylor_all_songs.csv")


library(ggplot2)

taylor_all_songs |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = danceability, y = energy)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = album_name), na.rm = TRUE) +
  labs(
    title = "Danceability and Energy of All Taylor Songs",
    x = "Danceability", 
    y = "Energy"
  ) + theme_gray()








The TidyTuesday data can be found at: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2023/2023-10-17/taylor_all_songs.csv
The taylor R package, created by W. Jake Thompson, offers a curated collection of Taylor Swift songs featuring both lyrics and audio attributes. The dataset draws its information from Genius and the Spotify API.

title: charlotte friedman
text: welcome to my data science website! i am a current junior at pomona college majoring in cognitive science with a concentration in human-centered design (including data science)! outside academics, i love playing with my dog alfie, listening to music while driving, and skiing.

title: spotify all songs
text:
This data set comes from the spotifyr R package, which is an API wrapper for Spotifyâ€™s Web API. It provides track-level and artist-level audio feature data that can be accessed directly from Spotify. The visualization displays the relationship between the average duration of the song by each year. It shows the average song length data for each year from prior to 1960 until 2020.

library(readr)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

spotify_songs <- read_csv("spotify_songs.csv")

spotify_songs <- spotify_songs |>
  mutate(year = as.integer(substr(track_album_release_date, 1, 4)))

spotify_songs |> 
  group_by(year) |> 
  summarise(mean_duration = mean(duration_ms)/60000) |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = mean_duration)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(y = "Duration (minutes)", title = "Average song duration over time")








The TidyTuesday data can be found at: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2020/2020-01-21/spotify_songs.csv
The data comes from Spotify via the spotifyr R package, and was also authored by Charlie Thompson, Josiah Parry, Donal Phipps, and Tom Wolff.
